t: For the choir director; set to Al-tashheth. A Mikhtam of David, when he fled from Saul in the cave.
Be*pn gracious to me, O God, be gracious to me, For*ln my soul takes refuge in You; And*ln in the shadow of Your wings I will take refuge Until*ln destruction passes by.
I*ln will cry to God Most High, To*ln God who accomplishes all*i things*i for me.
He*ln will send from heaven and save me; He*ln reproaches him who tramples upon me. Selah. God*ln will send forth His lovingkindness and His truth.
My*ln soul is among lions; I*ln must lie among those who breathe forth fire, Even*iln the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows And*ln their tongue a sharp sword.
Be*ln exalted above the heavens, O God; Let*iln Your glory be*i above all the earth.
They*ln have prepared a net for my steps; My*ln soul is bowed down; They*ln dug a pit before me; They*ln themselves*i have fallen into the midst of it. Selah.
My*ln heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast; I*ln will sing, yes, I will sing praises!
Awake,*ln my glory! Awake,*ln harp and lyre! I*ln will awaken the dawn.
I*ln will give thanks to You, O Lord, among the peoples; I*ln will sing praises to You among the nations.
For*ln Your lovingkindness is great to the heavens And*ln Your truth to the clouds.
Be*ln exalted above the heavens, O God; Let*iln Your glory be*i above all the earth.
